text:
August 20, 1959
Dr* Kenneth Harwood, Chairman
Department of Telecommunications
University of Southern California
University Park
Los Angeles 7, California
Dear Ken:
It was good talking to you on the phone the other day*
Thank you very much for calling. 1 am still trying to get this
date business settled for our meeting - and am going to have to
settle it one way or the other within the next few days* At
this point, I do not believe that we are going to be able to
satisfy more than about half of the members (though whether it
is the half able to come or the half unable to come which will
be more satisfied, X am not certain)*
After we talked, I thought of another likely candidate
for the position you mentioned* He is John Ulrich who is now at
Pittsburgh* John got his Ph*D. with us. He is now an associate
professor at Pittsburgh* Very good production man and quite in¬
terested in research. He is not only interested in research but,
unlike many people in our field who claim an interest, he works
at it! I do not know how well you know John* I believe that he
is one of the nicest persons I have ever known. When he was at
Iowa, he was a wonderful person to have in television production
because he got on well with everyone and he knew and was friendly
with practically everyone on the campus* This facilitated getting
these people on programs* I visited the University of Pittsburgh
this spring and found that he was quite highly thought of there*
He had a chance to move into administration and turned it down in
order to continue teaching and doing research. Think that he
would be an asset to your staff.
If there is other information which I can supply, or any¬
thing else that 1 can do, please let me know.
Best,
Samuel L. Becker
Director, Division of
Television-Radio-Film
